sections.heading: What are Pre-noun Adjectivals?
sections.content:
Pre-noun adjectivals (連体詞 rentaishi) are special words that can ONLY modify nouns directly - they cannot be used as predicates or stand alone. Unlike adjectives, they never take です/だ and always come before nouns. Common examples include 大きな, 小さな, この, あの, どの, and いわゆる.

大きな家 "A big house" この本 "This book" あの人 "That person" Cannot say: *家は大きな ⚠️

children.heading: Only before nouns
children.content: 大きな家 ✓ "A big house" 家は大きな ⚠️ Wrong - cannot be predicate Must modify noun

children.heading: No conjugation
children.content: 大きな家 大きな家 大きな家 Never changes form No tense, no negation

children.heading: 大きな/小さな
children.content: 大きな問題 "A big problem" 小さな子供 "A small child" Similar to 大きい/小さい But only before nouns

children.heading: この/その/あの/どの
children.content: この本 "This book" その人 "That person" あの店 "That store" どの車 "Which car" Demonstratives

children.heading: あらゆる (all kinds of)
children.content: あらゆる方法 "All kinds of methods" あらゆる可能性 "Every possibility" Comprehensive meaning

children.heading: いわゆる (so-called)
children.content: いわゆる専門家 "So-called experts" いわゆる常識 "So-called common sense" Quotation nuance

children.heading: たいした (considerable/great)
children.content: たいした問題 "A big problem" たいした人 "An impressive person" Often with negative

sections.heading: 大きな vs 大きい

children.heading: 大きな = pre-noun only
children.content: 大きな家 ✓ "A big house" 家は大きな ⚠️ Cannot be predicate Only modifies nouns

children.heading: 大きい = full adjective
children.content: 大きい家 ✓ "A big house" 家は大きい ✓ "The house is big" Can be predicate

children.heading: Usage difference
children.content: 大きな: Often for abstract/emotional 大きな問題 "a big problem" 大きな影響 "a big influence" 大きい: Often for physical size 大きい箱 "a big box" 大きい建物 "a big building" Both can be used Slight nuance difference

sections.heading: 小さな vs 小さい

children.heading: 小さな = pre-noun only
children.content: 小さな家 ✓ "A small house" 家は小さな ⚠️ Cannot be predicate

children.heading: 小さい = full adjective
children.content: 小さい家 ✓ "A small house" 家は小さい ✓ "The house is small" Can be predicate

children.heading: この (this)
children.content: この本 "This book" この人 "This person" Near speaker

children.heading: その (that)
children.content: その本 "That book" その人 "That person" Near listener

children.heading: あの (that over there)
children.content: あの本 "That book (over there)" あの人 "That person (over there)" Far from both

children.heading: どの (which)
children.content: どの本 "Which book" どの人 "Which person" Question word

children.heading: Must have noun
children.content: Wrong: これは大きな ⚠️ Correct: これは大きな家 ✓ "This is a big house" Or: これは大きい ✓ "This is big" (using 大きい) Need noun for pre-noun words

children.heading: Comprehensive meaning
children.content: あらゆる分野 "All fields" あらゆる手段 "Every means" All possible types

children.heading: Usage
children.content: あらゆる努力をした "Made every effort" あらゆる問題 "All problems" Emphasizes totality

children.heading: Introducing common terms
children.content: いわゆる「AI」 "So-called 'AI'" いわゆる専門家 "So-called experts" Sometimes skeptical tone

children.heading: Quotation function
children.content: いわゆる常識 "What is called common sense" Referencing known concepts

children.heading: Positive meaning
children.content: たいした人 "An impressive person" たいした腕前 "Considerable skill" Usually impressive

children.heading: With negative (not much)
children.content: たいしたことない "Not a big deal" たいした問題じゃない "Not a serious problem" Common with negatives

children.heading: ある (a certain)
children.content: ある日 "One day / A certain day" ある人 "A certain person" Indefinite specific

children.heading: Cannot be predicate here
children.content: Wrong: 日はある ⚠️ (This means "there is a day") Different meaning

children.heading: さる (a certain - formal)
children.content: さる筋 "A certain source" さる方 "A certain person" Very formal

children.heading: 去る (past/last)
children.content: 去る3月 "Last March" 去る○○日 "On the ○○th of last month" Formal, written

children.heading: Pre-noun + adjective
children.content: この大きい家 "This big house" あの美しい花 "That beautiful flower" Can combine

children.heading: Order matters
children.content: Pre-noun comes first: この新しい本 ✓ "This new book" 新しいこの本 ⚠️ Unnatural

children.heading: Using as predicate
children.content: Wrong: 家は大きな ⚠️ Correct: 家は大きい ✓ "The house is big" Use regular adjective

children.heading: Conjugating
children.content: Wrong: 大きなかった ⚠️ Wrong: 大きなくない ⚠️ Cannot conjugate No tense or negative forms

children.heading: Adding です/だ directly
children.content: Wrong: 問題は大きなだ ⚠️ Correct: 問題は大きい ✓ Or: 大きな問題だ ✓ Need full adjective for predicate

children.heading: ない as pre-noun
children.content: Common mistake: 行かない人 ✓ "A person who doesn't go" (This is verb negative, not pre-noun) ない本 ⚠️ Wrong - use ない as adjective differently

children.heading: With の for possession
children.content: この人の本 "This person's book" その人の家 "That person's house" Combining particles

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 大きな家 "A big house" 小さな子供 "A small child" この本 "This book" あの人 "That person" あらゆる可能性 "Every possibility" いわゆる専門家 "So-called experts"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: これは私が住んでいる大きな家です "This is the big house where I live" あの小さな店はとても有名です "That small store is very famous" この本は昨日買ったものです "This book is the one I bought yesterday" あらゆる方法を試したが、うまくいかなかった "I tried every method, but it didn't work out" いわゆる「成功」の定義は人それぞれだ "The definition of so-called 'success' differs by person"

children.heading: Company
children.content: About Pricing Blog Contact
